This allowed Atari to enter the handheld market

595.text: specifications, it's not hard to see why;

598.text: The console has 5 processors in 3 chips.

602.text:
The first is Tom, consisting of 750,000 transistors
and clocked at 26.591MHz.

607.text:
The 32 bit RISC architecture is responsible
for the system's graphical processing.

614.text:
This chip also incorporates a 64 bit object
processor and 64 bit blitter processor for

622.text:
The system could technically handle unlimited

625.text:

time.

628.text:
The second chip, Jerry, has 600,000 transistors
and is a 32-bit Digital Signal Processor clocked

636.text:
It's able to produce CD Quality sound, with
full stereo capability and wavetable synthesis.

642.text:
The processor can also perform complex mathematical
functions.

647.text:
A Motorola 68000 clocked at 13.295MHz provides
general purpose ability.

653.text:
The consoles 64 bit bus can transport a whopping
106.4 Mega Bytes per second

660.text:
16.8 million colours are available allowing
for 2D games which look staggering.

667.text:
Port wise, the Jag has a 32 bit cartridge
slot, an RF video output and a video edge

673.text: connector supporting both NTSC and PAL.

676.text:
